function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Parasite resistance to drugs and mosquito resistance to insecticides","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduced funding and lack of community participation","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on insecticide-based control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indiscriminate use of ddt for malaria control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of sub-saharan africa from global malaria eradication programme","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of residual insecticides","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pitching camps near refuse, debris, and loose rocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spraying chemicals around tents and buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Habitat destruction","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of traps and targets for pest control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Anopheles gambiae eradication","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population densities of ae. aegypti in rio de janeiro","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Colonial expansion in ssa and massive outbreaks of hat","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Game destruction in southern rhodesia for tsetse control","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of mosquito-borne diseases like malaria and yellow fever due to standing water and unsanitary living conditions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High human toxicity and ecological concerns from the use of paris green for larviciding.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vector control tools implemented for malaria","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Outbreaks of yellow fever and malaria taking the lives of us soldiers in cuba","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on labor-intensive environmental control measures for vbd control","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of housing improvements for vbd prevention","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of vector ecology and behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of historical vector control knowledge","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of disease transmission routes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of environmental management","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insect-borne diseases like malaria, hat, leishmaniasis, lf, and onchocerciasis may spread due to ineffective vector control methods.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of gene drive mosquitoes could lead to unintended consequences in the ecosystem, such as the decline of other species or the emergence of new diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Release of wolbachia-carrying mosquitoes could unintentionally introduce new pathogens or disrupt the balance of existing microbial communities in the environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The use of spatial repellents in combating vector-borne diseases could lead to the development of resistance in mosquito populations, rendering the repellents ineffective.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of chemical-based vector control tools may lead to environmental contamination and harm non-target species.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited use of vaccines for diseases like dengue due to safety concerns may hinder effective disease control and prevention.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Genetic manipulation of mosquitoes and other novel vector control tools may have unintended consequences on ecosystems and biodiversity.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transmission of vector-borne diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Co-endemicity of multiple vector-borne diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of neglected tropical diseases ntds","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sanitation and hygiene practices in food trucks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in food trucks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Crowding and close contact in food truck queues","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mentions of serving and interacting with a neighborhood and people, potentially indicating close contact and interaction.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The mention of maldives and international travel, indicating potential movement across borders and exposure to different disease ecosystems.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to contagious diseases from indigenous communities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unsanitary conditions from local schools and communities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness about disease prevention and containment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal of coronavirus-related medical waste","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reuse of face masks made from coffee","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close consumer closeness in the age of social distancing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through close contact during classes and interview sessions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and education about contagious diseases and preventive measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate healthcare facilities and response protocols for disease outbreaks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collaborating with other businesses may lead to increased exposure to contagious diseases if proper precautions are not diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
